data.title: 12U Coed Fall Program Registration Open
data.summary: Now accepting registration for the 12U Coed Fall Program which is available for players 12 and under. No tryouts necessary. The first of the two six-week sessions starts 9/22. See the 12U Coed Fall Program page for more information.
data.detail: Now accepting registration for the 12U Coed Fall Program which is available for players 12 and under. Practices are one hour per week for a 6-week program. No experience necessary. No tryouts necessary. We will be running two six-week sessions for the fall starting 9/22. See the 12U Coed Fall Program page for more information.

data.title: Annual Pumas Picnic Details
data.summary: The annual Pumas Picnic will be held Saturday May 11th from 1-5pm at the Plaistow YMCA in Plaistow, NH. This is a great way to end the season with some great food and playing volleyball. Read on for more details...
data.detail:
You are invited to our 15th annual Pumas Picnic which will be held Saturday May 11th at the Plaistow YMCA in Plaistow, NH. This is a great way to end the season with some great food and playing volleyball.

This is a catered event, with great food, volleyball, and door prizes! We will be at the Plaistow YMCA in Plaistow, NH. You may be familiar with the inside of the facility but they have several sand courts out back. We will have sand and grass courts set up to play on.

The picnic begins at 1 PM with lunch being served shortly after, continuously, until around 3:30PM. This is followed by our door prize raffle. The raffle is free for all players and coaches present. The picnic winds down around 5 PM. If you want to come early and help set up nets we start that at 12pm.

Coaches, TD’s and Players eat for free; family members who want to join us in lunch pay $15, or $10 for 12 and under. The menu is is still being worked on and will be announced at a later date. You do not need to purchase tickets to attend (only to eat). You are welcome to bring your own food and eat with us if you wish. No prepaying for tickets, you pay at the door. To help with ordering an accurate estimate of food please fill out a short survey. Please fill this out by April 28th.

Let's keep our fingers crossed for great weather and we hope to see you there!

Rain date: date and location TBD

data.title: Sad News
data.summary: It is with deep sorrow that we let you know of the passing of Jack Grosslein of Georgetown. Jack was an exceptional person who we were lucky enough to have coached for Pumas. Our heartfelt condolences go out to his wife Lyn and his two daughters, Kate and Sara.
data.detail:
Hello Coaches, Parents and Players,

It is with deep sorrow that we let you know of the passing of Jack Grosslein of Georgetown. Jack was an exceptional person who we were lucky enough to have coached for Pumas. Our heartfelt condolences go out to his wife Lyn and his two daughters, Kate and Sara. Jacks obituary and service information can be found here

VISITATION

Saturday January 26, 2019 10:00 AM to 1:00 PM
Conte-Giamberardino Funeral Home
14 Pleasant Street Georgetown, MA 01833

CELEBRATION OF LIFE

Saturday January 26, 2019 1:30 PM
Groveland Fairways
156 Main Street Groveland, MA 01834

Thank you,
Stephen Boyle
Pumas Volleyball Club

data.title: Updated Program Information & Tryout Registration Open!
data.summary: Tryout registration for the 2019 season is open! Program & Tryout information for the 2019 season has been updated on the web site. Read below for important updates to Club and Open programs, registration process and the in-house skills programs.
data.detail:
Tryout Dates

  • Sunday November 18th
  • Sunday, November 25th
See the Tryout Schedule for more details. If you have to miss a tryout date please see the Frequently Asked Questions page which will let you know what happens.

Program and Tryout Costs

Updated program cost and important date information can be found on the Programs Cost page.

Program Updates

Club teams will have practice on Tuesday and Saturday. All teams will participate in Winterfest, Boston and Rhode Island Rumble multi-day tournaments in additional to the regional NERVA tournaments. Season fees paid in two or three payment installments. See the Open Program , Club Program and Programs Cost pages for more details.

Registration Updates

Tryout registration for the 2019 season is open! See the Tryout Registration page for more details

We have added your tournament availability for all tournament dates onto registration. This is to help during team building and especially for the first tournament (Winterfest) which comes the first two weekends of January. Print the tournament availabiity worksheet and fill out to have all the information ready when you register.

This is important as teams will be registered for the Winterfest tournament according to your responses on the registration. Make sure Parents and players go over this together - If you respond you can attend you will held financially responsible for that tournament (multi day tournaments only for club teams).

See the Tryout Registration page for more details

data.title: Pre-Tryout Tune Up Clinics
data.summary: Volleyball MD is hosting two tune up clinics to prepare players for club tryouts. The clinics will run the same drills used at Pumas club tryouts. It is a great opportunity to become familiar with the tryout drills before tryouts.
data.detail:
Pumas VBC is sponsoring Volleyball MD to host two tune up clinics to prepare players for club volleyball tryouts. The clinics will be held on the following dates:
  • Sunday November 4th - Lawrence Boys & Girls Club
  • Sunday, November 11th - Lawrence Boys & Girls Club
The clinics will run the same drills used at Pumas club tryouts. It is a great opportunity to learn the tryout drill mechanics before the day of tryouts as well as a chance for some extra touches if you haven’t been on the court since your high school season ended. Please see the Tune Up Clinics flyer for more details. Register online at the VolleyballMD web site .

data.title: Annual Pumas Picnic Details
data.summary: The annual Pumas Picnic will be held Sunday June 3rd from 1-5pm at the Plaistow YMCA in Plaistow, NH. This is a great way to end the season with some great food and playing volleyball. Read on for more details...
data.detail:
You are invited to our 15th annual Pumas Picnic which will be held Sunday June 3rd from 1-5pm at the Plaistow YMCA in Plaistow, NH. This is a great way to end the season with some great food and playing volleyball.

This is a catered event, with great food, volleyball, and door prizes! We will be at a new venue this year - Plaistow YMCA in Plaistow, NH. You may be familiar with the inside of the facility but they have several sand courts out back. We will have sand and grass courts set up to play on.

The picnic begins at 1 PM with lunch being served shortly after, continuously, until around 3:30PM. This is followed by our door prize raffle. The raffle is free for all players and coaches present. The picnic winds down around 5 PM. If you want to come early and help set up nets we start that at 12pm.

Coaches, TD’s and Players eat for free; family members who want to join us in lunch pay $15, or $10 for 12 and under. The menu is is still being worked on and will be announced at a later date. You do not need to purchase tickets to attend (only to eat). You are welcome to bring your own food and eat with us if you wish. No prepaying for tickets, you pay at the door. To help with ordering an accurate estimate of food please fill out a short survey. Please fill this out by May 20th.

Rain date: Wednesday June 6th 5:30-7:30, location TBD

data.title: Potential 14U Open Team for 2018
data.summary: There has been interest this year is having a 14U Open team. While this is not a registration choice, we will look to see who can commit to this at the first tryout.
data.detail: There has been interest this year is having a 14U Open team. While this is not a registration choice, we will look to see who can commit to this at the first tryout. If interested, register for the 13/14 club. You will receive an email reminder before the tryouts. We will have a meeting during tryouts on the 19th to discuss forming a 14U Open team. Cost: $1840, Tournaments: Winterfest, Boston, Albany or Philly, Rhode Island Rumble (if spot available), 5 NERVA tournaments.

data.title: Troubles with Links on the Web Site?
data.summary: There are known issues with older verions of Internet Explorer. Trying a different browser such as Google Chrome or FireFox has proven to work without problems.
data.detail:
If you are experiencing problems with the various URL links on the web site, try holding the SHIFT key down while you click the Refresh button on your web browser. If this does not correct the problem, try clearing the web browser cache (see Google for the instructions for your specific web browser).

There are known issues with older verions of Internet Explorer. Trying a different browser such as Google Chrome or FireFox has proven to work without problems.

data.title: Pre-Tryout Tune Up Clinics
data.summary: Volleyball MD is hosting two tune up clinics to prepare players for club tryouts. The clinics will run the same drills used at Pumas club tryouts. It is a great opportunity to become familiar with the tryout drills before tryouts.
data.detail:
Pumas VBC is sponsoring Volleyball MD to host two tune up clinics to prepare players for club volleyball tryouts. The clinics will be held on the following dates:
  • Sunday November 5th - UML Rec Center
  • Sunday, November 12th - Lawrence Boys & Girls Club
The clinics will run the same drills used at Pumas club tryouts. It is a great opportunity to learn the tryout drill mechanics before the day of tryouts as well as a chance for some extra touches if you haven’t been on the court since your high school season ended. Please see the Tune Up Clinics flyer for registration details.

data.title: Sad News
data.summary: It is with deep sorrow that we let you know of the passing of Louis Remigio of Tewksbury, the father of Pumas Ruby coach Ali Remigio. Our heartfelt condolences go out to Ali and her sister Danielle.
data.detail:
Hello Coaches, Parents and Players,

It is with deep sorrow that we let you know of the passing of Louis Remigio of Tewksbury, the father of Pumas Ruby coach Ali Remigio. Our heartfelt condolences go out to Ali and her sister Danielle. Louis's obituary and service information can be found here.

Thank you,
Stephen Boyle
Pumas Volleyball Club

data.title: 14th Annual Pumas Picnic Postponed
data.summary: Unfortunately, the Pumas season ending picnic is postponed until June or July :o(
data.detail: Unfortunately, the Pumas season ending picnic is postponed until June or July (date to be determined by available facility). There was a pipe that broke at the campground that we were going to use and the resulting flood, along with all the rain we have had, has made the area unusable.

data.title: 14th Annual Pumas Picnic
data.summary: 14th Annual Pumas Picnic on Sunday May 21st 1-5PM. This is a catered event, with great food, volleyball, and door prize raffle!
data.detail:
Hello Players, Parents and Coaches, you are invited to our 14th Annual Pumas Picnic on Sunday May 21st 1-5PM. This is a catered event, with great food, volleyball, and door prize raffle! The picnic will be held at:

Camp Y Wood
58 Liberty St.
Salem, NH 03079
https://goo.gl/maps/4wP98V8TPxx

Coaches, TDs and Players eat for free. Family members who want to join us in lunch pay $15 ($10 age 12 and under). To help with ordering an accurate estimate of food please fill out a short survey. In the event of bad weather, the rain date is: Tuesday May 23 from 5:30-7:30, location TBD.

data.title: Sad News
data.summary: It is with deep sorrow that we let you know of the passing of Judith Malin, the mother and grandmother of three of our Pumas family. Our heartfelt condolences go out to Holli Roberts, our extraordinary tryout registration wizard, and her daughters Casey, a long time Pumas player and now current coach, and Heather, a current Pumas player.
data.detail:
Hello Coaches, Parents and Players,

It is with deep sorrow that we let you know of the passing of Judith Malin, the mother and grandmother of three of our Pumas family. Our heartfelt condolences go out to Holli Roberts, our extraordinary tryout registration wizard, and her daughters Casey, a long time Pumas player and now current coach, and Heather, a current Pumas player.

In lieu of flowers, donations can be made to:

  • Veteran's Agent - Town of Canton, 901 Washington Street, Canton, MA 02021
  • Temple Beth Abraham - 1301 Washington Street, Canton, MA 02021
  • Dana Farber Head & Neck Treatment Center - PO Box 849168, Boston MA 02284-9168

Thank you,
Stephen Boyle
Pumas Volleyball Club

data.title: NERVA 16 and 18 Qualifier Highlights
data.summary: Pumas 15U, 16U and 18U teams competed in the NERVA Qualifier tournaments. Below are the tournament results for Pumas teams competing in the open division.
data.detail:
NERVA Qualifier Tournament Results.

16U Open Division

  • Pumas 16U Emerald tied for 17th and will compete in Open Bronze
  • Pumas 16U Obsidian tied for 25th and will compete in Open Copper
  • Pumas 15U Ebony tied for 33rd and will compete in AAA

18U Open Division

  • Pumas 18U Jade tied for 9th and will compete in Open Silver
  • Pumas 18U Crimson tied for 33rd and will compete in Open Iron
  • Pumas 18U Viridian tied for 41st and will compete in AAA

data.title: Winterfest 2017 Highlights
data.summary: Two great weekends of volleyball at Winterfest 2017! Below are some of the tournament highlights.
data.detail:
Two great weekends of volleyball at Winterfest 2017! Tournament result highlights.

Winterfest Weekend #1

  • Pumas 14U Amethyst 13th 14 USA division
  • Pumas 15U Ebony 7th 15 Open division
  • Pumas 15U Indigo 13th 15 USA division
  • Pumas 15U Cobalt 17th 15 USA division

Winterfest Weekend #2

  • Pumas 16U Midnight 10th 16 USA division
  • Pumas 16U Emerald 15th 16 Open division
  • Pumas 18U Viridian 5th 18 Club division
  • Pumas 18U Ruby 11th 18 Club division
  • Pumas 18U Jade 3rd 18 USA division

data.title: Sad News
data.summary: It is with a heavy heart that Pumas lets you know that Maureen Staudt of North Andover, mother of Emma Staudt, passed away Thursday December 1st. Our heartfelt condolences go out to Emma, her father Jim and her brother Joseph.
data.detail:
Hello Coaches, Parents and Players,

It is with a heavy heart that Pumas let you know that Maureen Staudt of North Andover, mother of Emma Staudt, passed away Thursday December 1st. Our heartfelt condolences go out to Emma, her father Jim and her brother Joseph.

Thank you,
Stephen Boyle
Pumas Volleyball Club

data.title: New Website
data.summary: Pumas has a new web site! The new web site provides a modern browsing experience with support for mobile devices.
data.detail:
Pumas has a new web site! The new web site provides a modern browsing experience with support for mobile devices.

Enhancements to optimize support for mobile devices are planned for January. Photo galleries and teams rosters from previous seasons will be added over the next few months as well.

data.title: 12U Tryout Changes
data.summary: 12U Tryout Only: 12s tryouts, originally scheduled for 11/27 and 12/3, have been moved to 12/4 and 12/11
data.detail: 12U Tryout Only: 12s tryouts, originally scheduled for 11/27 and 12/3, have been moved to 12/4 and 12/11 at the Lawrence Boys + Girls Club from 8:30-10 am. If interested in playing, you can register online and contact the club director, Stephen Boyle at pumasvolleyballclub@gmail.com

data.summary: Pumas Volleyball Club is always looking for coaches (head or assistant).
